reviewText: I grew up watching Soul Train and continued until about the mid 80's.  It was good to see the new and old dancers of the show.  A must have if your a fan...even more so now that Mr. Cornelius has passed on.

damita joe and sharon hill were the only dancers that i knew there from the time i watched soul train and they had such a breif stint on camera they were featured in the Right on magazine though honestly to say flo jenkins the editor made and appearance as well this is not the tradional soul train this is more like the shemar moore years from what i can see

I am so glad I had an opportunity to finally get my DVD, its a very good video. Its for the whole family...I saw some of my favorite friends from when I used to be on the show....that I have not seen in a long time. so much to see; it kept me entertained until the end.....I can't wait until the next party.....it was worth waiting for....finally, I can't believe there were so many original dancers there doing their thang, They really looked good out there.

I started looking at Soul Train in the early 70's. I thought I was going to see the dancers talk about their Soul Train experiences and see flashbacks from the show. This was awful..PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. Children and former dancers are performing dance routines (badly). There's also a hideous dance show. Imagine if your ghetto classmates decided to have a prom reunion...this is much worst
